examples.sql: SELECT SUM(cost) as total_cost FROM cost_analysis
examples.explanation: Simple aggregation to get total cost across all records

examples.sql: SELECT application, SUM(cost) as total_cost FROM cost_analysis GROUP BY application ORDER BY total_cost DESC LIMIT 5
examples.explanation: Group by application and sum costs, then order by cost descending

examples.sql: SELECT environment, SUM(cost) as total_cost, COUNT(*) as record_count FROM cost_analysis GROUP BY environment ORDER BY total_cost DESC
examples.explanation: Aggregate costs by environment with record counts

examples.sql: SELECT cloud, AVG(cost) as avg_cost, MIN(cost) as min_cost, MAX(cost) as max_cost FROM cost_analysis GROUP BY cloud ORDER BY avg_cost DESC
examples.explanation: Statistical summary of costs by cloud provider

examples.sql: SELECT SUM(cost) as monthly_cost FROM cost_analysis WHERE date >= DATE_TRUNC(CURRENT_DATE(), MONTH)
examples.explanation: Filter to current month and sum all costs
